contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:USSAbsaroka1917.jpg|300px|USS Absaroka (1917)]] --> |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= {{USN flag|1919}} |Ship name= USS ''Absaroka '' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder= Skinner & Eddy |Ship laid down= |Ship launched= 1917 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= 17 September 1918 |Ship decommissioned= 4 March 1919 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reclassified= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship fate= Returned to [[United States Shipping Board]] |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= |Ship displacement={{convert|12397|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} |Ship length= {{convert|423|ft|9|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|54|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= {{convert|24|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed= {{convert|11|kn|mph km/h|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship complement=70 |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=* 1 × {{convert|6|in|mm|abbr=on}} gun <br/ > * 1 × {{convert|3|in|mm|abbr=on}} gun |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Absaroka''''' was a [[steamboat|steamer]] in the service of the [[United States Navy]], named after the [[Absaroka Range]] of mountains in [[Montana]] and [[Wyoming]]. ''Absaroka'' was built in 1917 for the [[United States Shipping Board]] by [[Skinner & Eddy]] Company, [[Seattle, Washington]], taken over by the Navy on a [[Bareboat charter|bare boat]] basis on 17 September 1918, and commissioned that same day, [[Lieutenant commander|Lt. Comdr.]] [[O. W. Hughes]] in command. ''Absaroka'' was assigned to the [[Naval Overseas Transportation Service]] following her commissioning. Between October 1918 and February 1919, the ship made two transatlantic voyages carrying Army cargo to ports in [[France]], [[England]], and the [[Netherlands]]. During her second trip, ''Absaroka'' rescued the captain and crew of the disabled [[United Kingdom|British]] steamer ''War Marvel'' and landed them safely at [[Falmouth, Cornwall|Falmouth, England]]. The ship arrived in [[City of New York|New York City]] on 12 February 1919 and was immediately drydocked for overhaul. ''Absaroka'' was decommissioned on 4 March 1919 and returned to the United States Shipping Board. ==References== * {{DANFS}} <!-- non-breaking space to keep AWB drones from altering the space before the navbox--> {{Design 1013 ships}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Absaroka (AD-13)}} [[Category:1917 ships]] [[Category:Design 1013 ships of the United States Navy]] [[Category:Design 1013 ships]] [[Category:Ships built in Washington (state)]] [[Category:World War I cargo ships of the United States]]
